intro: Paronychia setigera subsp. argillicola, commonly known as the clayland sandwort, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to the western United States. It typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, aiding in water retention. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with four petals, and bloom in early spring. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is adapted to harsh, dry conditions.
